intro: Wachendorfia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf wachendorfia, is a low-growing, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Wachendorfia humilis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its drought tolerance and attractive floral display.
